io.sphere.sdk.queries

Interface MetaModelExpansionDsl<T,C,E>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CartByCustomerIdFetch, CartByIdFetch, CartDiscountByIdFetch, CartDiscountQuery, CartQuery, CategoryByIdFetch, CategoryQuery, ChannelByIdFetch, ChannelQuery, CustomerByIdFetch, CustomerByTokenFetch, CustomerGroupByIdFetch, CustomerGroupQuery, CustomerQuery, CustomObjectByKeyFetch<T>, CustomObjectQuery<T>, DiscountCodeByIdFetch, DiscountCodeQuery, InventoryEntryByIdFetch, InventoryEntryQuery, MetaModelFetchDsl<T,C,E>, MetaModelQueryDsl<T,C,Q,E>, OrderByIdFetch, OrderQuery, ProductByIdFetch, ProductProjectionByIdFetch, ProductProjectionQuery, ProductQuery, ProductTypeQuery, ReviewQuery, ShippingMethodByIdFetch, ShippingMethodQuery, StateQuery, TaxCategoryQuery, ZoneByIdFetch, ZoneQuery
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CustomObjectQueryImpl, MetaModelFetchDslImpl, MetaModelQueryDslImpl

    public interface MetaModelExpansionDsl<T,C,E>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      C plusExpansionPaths(java.util.function.Function<E,ExpansionPath<T>> m)
      Creates a new object with the properties of the old object but adds a new expansion path to it by using meta models.
      C withExpansionPaths(java.util.function.Function<E,ExpansionPath<T>> m)
      Creates a new object with the properties of the old object but replaces all expansion paths with a single expansionPath by using meta models.

    • Method Detail

      • plusExpansionPaths

        C plusExpansionPaths(java.util.function.Function<E,ExpansionPath<T>> m)
        Creates a new object with the properties of the old object but adds a new expansion path to it by using meta models.

        An example in the product projection context:

        final ProductProjectionByIdFetch fetch1 = ProductProjectionByIdFetch.of("id", ProductProjectionType.CURRENT)
        .plusExpansionPaths(m -> m.categories());
assertThat(fetch1.expansionPaths())
        .isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("categories[*]")));

final ProductProjectionByIdFetch fetch2 = fetch1.plusExpansionPaths(m -> m.productType());
assertThat(fetch2.expansionPaths())
        .isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("categories[*]"), ExpansionPath.of("productType")))
        .isEqualTo(listOf(fetch1.expansionPaths(), ExpansionPath.of("productType")));

//this is equivalent to

final ExpansionPath<ProductProjection> categoryExpand = ProductProjectionExpansionModel.of().categories();
final ExpansionPath<ProductProjection> productTypeExpand = ProductProjectionExpansionModel.of().productType();
final ProductProjectionByIdFetch fetchB = ProductProjectionByIdFetch.of("id", ProductProjectionType.CURRENT)
                .withExpansionPaths(asList(categoryExpand, productTypeExpand));
assertThat(fetchB.expansionPaths())
        .isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("categories[*]"), ExpansionPath.of("productType")));

        See the test code.
        Parameters:
        m - function to use the meta model for expansions to create an expansion path
        Returns:
        new object

      • withExpansionPaths

        C withExpansionPaths(java.util.function.Function<E,ExpansionPath<T>> m)
        Creates a new object with the properties of the old object but replaces all expansion paths with a single expansionPath by using meta models.

        An example in the product projection context:

        final ProductProjectionByIdFetch fetch = ProductProjectionByIdFetch.of("id", ProductProjectionType.CURRENT)
                .plusExpansionPaths(ProductProjectionExpansionModel.of().categories());

assertThat(fetch.expansionPaths())
        .isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("categories[*]")));

final ProductProjectionByIdFetch fetch2 =
        fetch.withExpansionPaths(m -> m.productType());

assertThat(fetch.expansionPaths()).overridingErrorMessage("old object is unchanged")
        .isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("categories[*]")));
assertThat(fetch2.expansionPaths()).isEqualTo(asList(ExpansionPath.of("productType")));
assertThat(fetch2).isNotSameAs(fetch);

        See the test code.
        Parameters:
        m - function to use the meta model for expansions to create an expansion path
        Returns:
        new object
